zone.line: Nor heed nor see, what things they be
But from these create he can
Forms more real than living man
Nurslings of immortality!—
One of them awakened me
And I sped to succour thee
Ione
Beholdst thou not two shapes from the East & west
Come, as two doves to one beloved nest
Sink through the lapses of the yielding air? —
And hark—their sweet sad voices ; 'tis despair
Mingled with love, & then dissolved in sound—
Panthea
Canst thou speak sister? all my words are drowned
Ione
voice
Thier beauty gives me words . See how they float
On their sustaining wings of skiey grain
Orange & azure, deepening into gold
Thier soft smiles light the air like a star's fire
5 th Spirit Chorus of Spirits
Hast thou beheld the form of Love?
